meanings.definition: A person who watches and identifies birds.
meanings.sent1: Birdwatchers use binoculars to see birds up close.
meanings.sent2: Many birdwatchers keep a journal of the birds they have spotted.
meanings.sent3: The birdwatchers were so focused on spotting a rare bird that they didn't notice the picnic nearby.
meanings.sent4: She had the keen eyesight of a birdwatcher, spotting movement in the trees from far away.
meanings.sent5: The group of birdwatchers gathered at dawn, eager to catch a glimpse of the elusive owl.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in the activity of observing and studying birds in their natural habitats.
meanings.sent1: Birdwatchers often wake up early to catch the birds during their most active time.
meanings.sent2: In the forest, birdwatchers quietly observe the different species flying around.
meanings.sent3: The birdwatchers joked that they were like detectives, solving the mystery of bird behavior.
meanings.sent4: The birdwatchers' patience paid off when they finally saw the rare migratory bird they were waiting for.
meanings.sent5: The group of birdwatchers shared stories of their favorite bird encounters around the campfire.
